purpose.summary: This COBOL program contains two paragraphs: 9999-ABEND, which is used to terminate the program abnormally, and 9999-EXIT, which provides a standard exit point. The ABEND paragraph displays a message and sets a non-zero return code before terminating the program.

paragraphs.purpose: This paragraph handles abnormal termination of the program. Its primary purpose is to provide a controlled exit point when an unrecoverable error occurs. It first displays the message 'IMSUNLOD ABENDING ...' to the console, indicating that the program is terminating abnormally (4). Then, it sets the RETURN-CODE to 16, signaling to the calling environment that the program ended with an error (6). Finally, it executes a GOBACK statement to terminate the program and return control to the operating system (7). This paragraph does not consume any specific input files or data, nor does it call any other paragraphs. It serves as a centralized error handling routine to ensure a consistent exit strategy.

This paragraph provides a standard exit point for the program. Its primary purpose is to allow the program to terminate normally. It simply executes an EXIT statement (10), which returns control to the calling program or operating system. This paragraph does not consume any input data, produce any output data, perform any business logic, or handle any errors. It also does not call any other paragraphs or programs. It serves as a clean and simple way to exit the program when processing is complete or when a normal termination is required.

error_handling.action: DISPLAY message and ABEND with return code 16
